alert.note: Alert for Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Surprise Valley California (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Watch issued October 09 at 1:54PM PDT until October 12 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 29 possible. * WHERE...Northern Washoe County, Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake, Surprise Valley California, Greater Reno- Carson City-Minden Area, Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties and Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties. * WHEN...From late Wednesday night through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Warmer urban areas around Reno will only dip into the low to mid-30s. Other valleys have a 40-70% chance of dropping below 32 degrees for 4-6 hours late Wednesday night into Thursday morning.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Surprise Valley California
